roles.title: senior accountant experience company name june 2011 - current senior accountant city , state prepare quarterly and annual financial statements for 17 multi-family communities for distribution - inves-rs and financial institutions. reconcile and account for all activity on the income statement and balance sheet including cash, fixed assets, derivatives, equity, and property debt. coordinate and review work of external audit firms. initiate capital calls and distributions for inves-rs. manage budgets and construction loan activity for approximately 100,000,000 in active construction projects in fl, ma, and md. company name

associate fund controller city , state performed quarterly and annual close procedures for msref morgan stanley real estate funds 6i, the largest international real estate investment fund - date with 8 billion of partnership assets, and draft financial statements distributed directly - fund inves-rs. lead quarterly management fee process by performing work - draft approximately 14,000,000 in bills - fund partners. develop work plan - ensure deadlines are met, test results, delegate work - other fund controllers, and perform detailed review of their work. lead msref 6i initiative - implement reinvestment of proceeds rop methodology - reallocate approximately 120,000,000 in cash --date amongst investments with deficient cash balances - cover contributions and expenses. write formulas - analyze cash movement in microsoft excel and assist four information technology vice presidents in programming the partner capital sub ledger system - calculate the movement and test results. wrote standard operating procedures memo for rop - train team members. company name

advisory, forensic and audit associate city , state performed research - locate red flags in numerous potential fraudulent mortgages at one of the largest bank failures in u.s. his-ry. developed writing skills by drafting over forty memorandums that summarized potential fraud in loans that were presented - multiple agencies of the government. wrote a thirty-five page corporate intelligence narrative explaining personal and professional relationships of an individual under investigation. these tasks assisted the fbi in arresting the individual, suspected of orchestrating a two billion dollar mortgage fraud scheme. performed substantive test work, analytical procedures, and testing of controls at multiple audit clients, including leading the sales and inven-ry test work of an international company with approximately one billion in annual sales. audited cash, receivables, investments, inven-ry, payables, property, debt, equity, revenue, cost of goods sold, and expenses. analyzed audit client s major accounting processes, identified control weaknesses, and recommended solutions and improvements. worked on multiple phases, including fraud investigations and data analytics, of a high profile engagement involving the largest natural disaster relief fund in united states his-ry and was the first - analyze, discuss, and research a series of fraud allegations received from an anonymous telephone hotline that lead - a new, lasting client relationship with the federal government. analyzed a series of bank accounts owned by over twenty cus-mers of a large, domestic bank - determine the amount of funds s-len and trace illicit transfers made by a bank employee from each account in a multi-million dollar fraud scheme.
